name: Bone Collector
movement: walking speed of 15 feet and flying speed of 60 feet, providing exceptional mobility
description: The Bone Collector is a small undead creature with a sinister appearance, capable of flying and characterized by a malevolent aura. It uses its talons to inflict harm and disease on its enemies.
memorable: Its ability to critically hit from a distance and to inflict a debilitating disease on its victims makes it a formidable and memorable foe.
goals: To disrupt and weaken opponents through disease and curses.
relations: Often associated with other undead creatures it can sense through its abilities.
environment: Typically found in graveyards or areas with a high concentration of the dead.
strengths: Possesses flight, critical hit capabilities from a distance, and various special abilities that enhance its combat effectiveness.
weaknesses: Low hit points and poor physical strength, limiting its resilience in direct combat.
attacks: Utilizes a melee attack with its talons, inflicting slashing damage and potentially causing disease.
most_powerful_ability: Call of the Grave: Allows attacks to score critical hits on a roll of 19 or 20 within a 60-foot radius.
senses: Has keen senses, allowing it to pinpoint the location of undead creatures and those recently deceased within a 60-foot radius.
skills: Proficient in perception, giving it heightened awareness to notice hidden or distant creatures.
additional_information: Immunity to necrotic and poison damage, making it resistant to specific attacks.
Does not require basic needs such as air, food, drink, or sleep due to its Undead Nature.
Magic Resistance provides advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.
The disease inflicted can lead to significant consequences, including death if untreated.
The Bad Omen ability can hinder opponents, making it easier for the Bone Collector to evade attacks.
